author: BBC News
description:
Protests are taking place in Minneapolis after a woman was fatally shot by a US ICE agent.

Accounts of what exactly happened are conflicting, with the Trump Administration citing self-defence whilst law makers in the city and state of Minnesota are calling it a brazen act of force.

Adam is joined by BBC North America correspondent, Anthony Zurcher, and BBC North America reporter, Madeline Halpert, who is on the ground and at the scene in Minneapolis.

In studio is BBC business editor Simon Jack, who got the scoop on the government’s latest change of heart about business rates for English pubs.

Subscribe here: bbc.co.uk/sounds/series/p05299nl

#BBCNews
title: What do we know about the Minneapolis ICE shooting? | BBC Newscast

author: BBC News
description:
The Lebanese army says it’s completed the first phase of a plan that would see the militia and political group Hezbollah give up its weapons.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has called these efforts “an encouraging beginning”, but says they are insufficient.

BBC Arabic’s Carine Torbey tells us what’s happening on the ground, and how Hezbollah gained so much power and influence in Lebanon.  

Subscribe to the Global News Podcast wherever you get your podcasts or find more episodes here: https://bbc.in/GlobalNewsPodcast

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews
title: Can Lebanon disarm Hezbollah? | Global News Podcast

author: BBC News
description:
A rare red wind warning comes into force for parts of south-west England as the UK is hit by Storm Goretti.
 
The Met Office warns to expect "flying debris resulting in danger to life" in the Isles of Scilly and Cornwall, with schools there closing early and all trains cancelled. 
 
This sort of warning is only issued in the most extreme circumstances, BBC Weather's Simon King says.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
#StormGoretti #BBCNews
title: Storm Goretti 'weather bomb' hits UK, as rare 'danger to life' warning comes into force | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
In an exclusive interview with BBC Newsbeat, one of the first graduates of the government's new Cyber Direct Entry Scheme has spoken about how gamers and coders have the skills to make it in a modern military.
 
Corporal Alex discusses how the scheme helped him realise a life-long ambition of joining the military and the appeal it could have for younger generations.
 
And Roman Davies, one of the RAF's esports stars, gives his thoughts on why gaming can be useful for some roles in the military.

Credit: Stock footage from Getty

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news

#Military #Gaming #BBCNews
title: Could gamers be the secret weapon in modern militaries? | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Today, the US has seized two oil tankers — one Russian-flagged vessel in the North Atlantic and another ship in the Caribbean. Both vessels have links to Venezuela.

The UK supported US efforts to seize the Russian-flagged ship, which is accused of breaking US sanctions by shipping Iranian oil.

What do we know so far and is this the closest Russia and the US have been to confrontation since the Cold War? Adam is joined by BBC international editor Jeremy Bowen and Michelle Wiese Bockmann, senior maritime intelligence analyst at Windward.

Also in the studio is BBC economics editor Faisal Islam, who’s back from a visit to Google HQ in California, where they are developing a quantum computer which could have capabilities beyond anything the world has yet seen. Faisal fills us in on what he learned from his trip.
title: US-Venezuela: Russian-flagged tanker seized by US military | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Children in Gaza have returned to school after years without formal education.
 
Tents now serve as classrooms but for many, this is the first return to routine and education since the war began on 7 October 2023.
 
According to Unicef, more than 97% of schools in Gaza were damaged or destroyed during the war. 
 
The IDF has made repeated claims that Hamas uses civilian infrastructure including schools to carry out operations but has rarely provided solid evidence.

author: BBC News
description:
When the US government captured Venezuela’s president, Nicolas Maduro, on Saturday, most of the world was shocked. But US officials had for years been gaming out different scenarios, including predicting what would happen if Maduro was ousted. According to one man who took part, each ended in disaster.

In this episode of The Global Story, we speak to the former Washington Post journalist Douglas Farah, who participated in war games on Venezuela during Donald Trump’s first term, as well as during the Obama and Biden administrations.
title: Trump, Maduro, and the war games that predicted chaos | The Global Story Podcast

author: BBC News
description:
The United States says it has seized two tankers linked to Venezuelan oil exports in "back-to-back" operations in the North Atlantic and the Caribbean.

US forces boarded the Russian-flagged Marinera after a pursuit lasting almost two weeks as it travelled through the waters between Iceland and Scotland. The UK Royal Navy gave logistical support by air and sea.

A second tanker - the M/T Sophia - was accused by the US of "conducting illicit activities" and boarded in the Caribbean.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Venezuela #BBCNews
title: US seizes two 'shadow fleet' tankers linked to Venezuelan oil | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
People who come off weight-loss injections such as Mounjaro or Wegovy can regain their lost pounds four times faster than those who stop conventional dieting and exercising, new research suggests.
 
The British Medical Journal has published data which suggests overweight people can shed about a fifth of their body weight when using jabs.
 
But once they quit they regain 0.8 kg every month, on average, meaning they return to their pre-treatment weight in a year-and-a-half.
 
Doctors say more studies of the longer-term effects of new slimming jabs would be helpful.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews
title: People who come off slimming jabs regain weight four times faster than dieters | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
A US immigration agent has shot dead a 37-year-old woman in the city of Minneapolis, sparking protests overnight.
 
Federal officials said the woman, Renee Nicole Good, had tried to run over immigration agents with her car but the city mayor said the agent who shot her had acted recklessly.
 
Videos of the incident show ICE agents approaching a car which is in the middle of the street. As it attempts to drive off, one of them points his gun at the driver and at least two shots are heard. The FBI is investigating.
 
Hundreds of ICE agents have been deployed to Minneapolis, in the state of Minnesota, as part of the White House's crackdown on illegal immigration.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#ICE #BBCNews
title: Protests held in Minneapolis after woman shot dead by US immigration agent | BBC News
